intro: Hiptage umbellulifera, commonly known as the Umbellate Hiptage, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Hiptage umbellulifera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along streambanks.
